definition: plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station
to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: It certainly varies with different locations. The rental term is for three years.
sentences.chinese: 實際租金則根據鋪子的而定，租期是三年。

sentences.english: Ah! yes, at the corner of a street; I can see the shop.
sentences.chinese: 啊，對，在一條街的拐角上，我想起那鋪子了。

sentences.english: Then he set up his business as a cycle repairer.
sentences.chinese: 他建起了自己的鋪子，成了一名自行車修理工。

sentences.english: I entered the shop of a pork butcher at the moment when his son， aged eight， was returning from school． The poor boy was weeping bitterly．
sentences.chinese: 我走進殺豬屠夫的鋪子，他八歲的兒子正好放學回家。

sentences.english: The two shops are next to each other.
Imagine, if you will, a typical silversmith's shop.
sentences.chinese: 如果你願意的話，想象一下吧，一個典型的銀匠鋪子。

sentences.english: What was Frank's job in a small shop?
sentences.chinese: 弗蘭克在一家小鋪子裏做什麼工作？

sentences.english: On our left were the shops, their windows lighted, and the entrance to the galleria .
sentences.chinese: 我們的左面是店窗明亮的鋪子和商業街廊的入口。
他兩手叉腰，站在鋪子前。

sentences.english: E. g He runs a small business in the town.
sentences.chinese: 他在鎮上經營一家小鋪子。

sentences.english: As a boy he used to work in a small shop.
sentences.chinese: 當他還是孩子時，他曾在一家小鋪子工作。

sentences.english: He developed the little shop into a big one.
sentences.chinese: 他把小鋪子發展成一家大商店。

sentences.english: The second shop fared better in the tsunami and damage was relatively less.
sentences.chinese: 第二個鋪子在海嘯後恢復得較快，遭受的損害比較輕。

sentences.english: Twice Sold Tales"is the name of a used-book store ."
sentences.chinese: “二手故事”是一家賣舊書的鋪子。

definition: variant of 伙計|伙计[huo3 ji5]
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
to set up a vendor's stall in the street
